publicationStmt.p: published electronically as part of the TLS project at https://hxwd.org

sourceDesc.p: Created by members of the TLS project

sense.def: Foucault: soin de soi> take good care of oneself
commit suicide for, sacrifice one's life for

tls:text.tls:line: ▼▼►▲ The only thing is that they are not quite harmonised into a unity (qiú).1----1Respect for friends in no way prevents candid friendly criticism.
►▲►► Those who come after one one should be slow to underestimate (wú),

sense.def: make unjustified negative comments on someone behind his back

tls:text.tls:line: ►■ Cao Pi addresses (you):

sense.def: address N, with the (written or spoken) message S

tls:text.tls:line: ■►►▼▼► Since we parted1 soon another2 four years will have gone.3----1The letter refers back to where the common experience with the addressee has stopped. This is perfectly current in the genre, of course. But we seem to have a demonstratively colloquial phrase in bié lái 別來, where lái 來 is semi-grammaticalised, unstressed.2Time passes at a disconcerting rate. Yet another four years gone. Lǐ Shàn 李善 was already worried about the use of xíng 行 in this place and glosses it as qiě 且 "be about to". 3Begins with time concepts and ends this sequence with them. Almost chiastic. But the tonal pattern as well as the diction are informal, almost talkative. In clear contrast with the gnomic first line.

■►►▼▼► Since we parted1 soon another2 four years will have gone.3----1The letter refers back to where the common experience with the addressee has stopped. This is perfectly current in the genre, of course. But we seem to have a demonstratively colloquial phrase in bié lái 別來, where lái 來 is semi-grammaticalised, unstressed.2Time passes at a disconcerting rate. Yet another four years gone. Lǐ Shàn 李善 was already worried about the use of xíng 行 in this place and glosses it as qiě 且 "be about to". 3Begins with time concepts and ends this sequence with them. Almost chiastic. But the tonal pattern as well as the diction are informal, almost talkative. In clear contrast with the gnomic first line.

■►►▼▼► Since we parted1 soon another2 four years will have gone.3----1The letter refers back to where the common experience with the addressee has stopped. This is perfectly current in the genre, of course. But we seem to have a demonstratively colloquial phrase in bié lái 別來, where lái 來 is semi-grammaticalised, unstressed.2Time passes at a disconcerting rate. Yet another four years gone. Lǐ Shàn 李善 was already worried about the use of xíng 行 in this place and glosses it as qiě 且 "be about to". 3Begins with time concepts and ends this sequence with them. Almost chiastic. But the tonal pattern as well as the diction are informal, almost talkative. In clear contrast with the gnomic first line.

sense.def: again (as in 復戰 "fight again, renew battle".(often of reverting to an original state:) again (失而復得"lose but regain again") occasionally and rarely adversative: on the contrary; (with negatives, not) any more, not any longer; but again

tls:text.tls:line: ►►■▼ Three years1 without meeting2----1Free association. Come to think of it, talking about almost four years, ...2They have not been meeting: the association makes explicit the personal experience.

►►►▼►▲ and at the Eastern Mountain song moans1 still2 about3 the distance.----1Tàn 嘆 is a graphic variant (five times in Shījīng) of the presumably more standard and dignified tàn 歎 (six times in Shījīng). There are cases where one does want to pay attention to the rhetorical function of graphic variants. This is not one of them.2In spite of the shorter time. Ode 156.自我不見， 3... Since we have not seen each other于今三年。 Three years have gone.3If with Grammata Serica Recensa 152a we allow ourselves a level tone reading for 嘆, then we get a long mono-tonic level series finished off with a deflected tone.

sense.def: still; nonetheless; in spite of everything (said in S and not said in S)

tls:text.tls:line: ►►►▼►▲ and at the Eastern Mountain song moans1 still2 about3 the distance.----1Tàn 嘆 is a graphic variant (five times in Shījīng) of the presumably more standard and dignified tàn 歎 (six times in Shījīng). There are cases where one does want to pay attention to the rhetorical function of graphic variants. This is not one of them.2In spite of the shorter time. Ode 156.自我不見， 3... Since we have not seen each other于今三年。 Three years have gone.3If with Grammata Serica Recensa 152a we allow ourselves a level tone reading for 嘆, then we get a long mono-tonic level series finished off with a deflected tone.

sense.def: to sigh about, heave sighs concerning (often sighs of admiration)

tls:text.tls:line: ►►►▼►▲ and at the Eastern Mountain song moans1 still2 about3 the distance.----1Tàn 嘆 is a graphic variant (five times in Shījīng) of the presumably more standard and dignified tàn 歎 (six times in Shījīng). There are cases where one does want to pay attention to the rhetorical function of graphic variants. This is not one of them.2In spite of the shorter time. Ode 156.自我不見， 3... Since we have not seen each other于今三年。 Three years have gone.3If with Grammata Serica Recensa 152a we allow ourselves a level tone reading for 嘆, then we get a long mono-tonic level series finished off with a deflected tone.

▼▲▼► How much more1 when one has exceeded this length of time!----1The literary reminiscence or allusion always serves to put the present into higher relief. The dissonant kuàng nǎi 況乃 probably do not constitute a constituent. The euphonic hé kuàng 何況 clearly does.

▼▲▼► How much more1 when one has exceeded this length of time!----1The literary reminiscence or allusion always serves to put the present into higher relief. The dissonant kuàng nǎi 況乃 probably do not constitute a constituent. The euphonic hé kuàng 何況 clearly does.

sense.def: exceed; go further than; be larger than

tls:text.tls:line: ▼▲▼► How much more1 when one has exceeded this length of time!----1The literary reminiscence or allusion always serves to put the present into higher relief. The dissonant kuàng nǎi 況乃 probably do not constitute a constituent. The euphonic hé kuàng 何況 clearly does.

►►▲► The thought,1 how could one2 bear it?3----1The nominal use of sī 思 "emotionally intense thought" is not unproblematic. One might wish to argue that "when one thinks of it" is quite adequate in the context as a way of construing the word. Cases of this sort are important not only for syntactic theory: they do make a difference to parallelistic interpretation.2Cao is impersonal: "I cannot bear it" is what he conveys, but in that impersonal mode which at the same time involves an appeal to the reader: "surely it cannot be borne with".3Cao reflects on his own attitude to what he describes. Playfully, I think, he goes on to elaborate on the ancient poem where people are "sighing". He simply cannot bear the separation. Dù Yù 杜預 comments on Zuǒzhuàn that: 不支，不能相支持也。"Bù zhī means 'cannot sustain it, live with it."

►►▲► The thought,1 how could one2 bear it?3----1The nominal use of sī 思 "emotionally intense thought" is not unproblematic. One might wish to argue that "when one thinks of it" is quite adequate in the context as a way of construing the word. Cases of this sort are important not only for syntactic theory: they do make a difference to parallelistic interpretation.2Cao is impersonal: "I cannot bear it" is what he conveys, but in that impersonal mode which at the same time involves an appeal to the reader: "surely it cannot be borne with".3Cao reflects on his own attitude to what he describes. Playfully, I think, he goes on to elaborate on the ancient poem where people are "sighing". He simply cannot bear the separation. Dù Yù 杜預 comments on Zuǒzhuàn that: 不支，不能相支持也。"Bù zhī means 'cannot sustain it, live with it."

sense.def: transitive verb which takes passivised verbs as object: be VERBable

tls:text.tls:line: ►►▲► The thought,1 how could one2 bear it?3----1The nominal use of sī 思 "emotionally intense thought" is not unproblematic. One might wish to argue that "when one thinks of it" is quite adequate in the context as a way of construing the word. Cases of this sort are important not only for syntactic theory: they do make a difference to parallelistic interpretation.2Cao is impersonal: "I cannot bear it" is what he conveys, but in that impersonal mode which at the same time involves an appeal to the reader: "surely it cannot be borne with".3Cao reflects on his own attitude to what he describes. Playfully, I think, he goes on to elaborate on the ancient poem where people are "sighing". He simply cannot bear the separation. Dù Yù 杜預 comments on Zuǒzhuàn that: 不支，不能相支持也。"Bù zhī means 'cannot sustain it, live with it."
▼■▼■ Years and months1 are easy to get (and use up).2----1The abstract notion of time is expressed in terms of concrete stretches of time.2Jocular sentential opening. Playfully gnomic in style.

sense.def: years and months; long periods of time

tls:text.tls:line: ▼■▼■ Years and months1 are easy to get (and use up).2----1The abstract notion of time is expressed in terms of concrete stretches of time.2Jocular sentential opening. Playfully gnomic in style. Compare LSCQ 時固不易得 "the right moment is certainly hard to find".

►►►▲▲ Even if1 letters and memorials2 go back and forth,3----1Cao does not say zòng 縱 "although": suī 雖 remains hypothetical in its "pregnant" uses.2At least from Han times onwards the shū 疏 were a recognised genre of submissions to the authorities. We must remember Cao Pi's high status as fù chéngxiàng 副承相. Shū 書 *qhlja is in fact not homophonous with shū 疏 *sqra: the words have different initials in Qièyùn 切韻 and Pan Wuyun has very different Old Chinese reconstructions.3The people ought to be going back and forth. The letters are not proper subjects of this going back and forth. This is a point at which Cao gets close to metaphorical diction. -ang and -an are pleasingly close and one needs to see to what extent these endings are felt to be approximate rhymes.

sense.def: make light of; think little of; be not afraid of; to slight, hold in disrespect, to fail to show the proper respect for (the law etc)
experience as small, find small; regard as small and insignificant; treat as inferior

tls:text.tls:line: writing in a letter to his elder brother Ban Zhao [33-108]:
writing in a letter to his elder brother Ban Zhao [33-108]:
writing in a letter to his elder brother Ban Zhao [33-108]:
"Wuzhong [Fu Yi] became Imperal Librarian through his facility in composition:

sense.def: because of V-ing; because one V-ed

tls:text.tls:line: "Wuzhong [Fu Yi] became Imperal Librarian through his facility in composition:

sense.def: have the capacity to VERB properly, be constitutionally able to VERB; be physically capable of, be actually able to

"Wuzhong [Fu Yi] became Imperal Librarian through his facility in composition:
"Wuzhong [Fu Yi] became Imperal Librarian through his facility in composition:
"Wuzhong [Fu Yi] became Imperal Librarian through his facility in composition:
whenever he used his writing brush, he couldn't stop himself."
whenever he used his writing brush, he couldn't stop himself."
whenever he used his writing brush, he couldn't stop himself."
whenever he used his writing brush, he couldn't stop himself."

sense.def: V the contextually determinate object oneself

tls:text.tls:line: People are good at [or fond of] making themselves known;
People are good at [or fond of] making themselves known;
but since literature is not of one form along
but since literature is not of one form along
few can be good at everything.
few can be good at everything.
few can be good at everything.
Thus each person disparages that in which he is weak

sense.def: Thus (with no clear logical connection with what precedes...)

sense.def: each of the subjects (each in their own manner); each and everyone

sense.def: excel in, be particularly good at

tls:text.tls:line: by the criterion of those things in which he is strong.
by the criterion of those things in which he is strong.
by the criterion of those things in which he is strong.
There is a village saying:
There is a village saying:
"The worn-out broom that belongs to my household

sense.def: tattered, worn thin; more generally: worn-down, unworthy

tls:text.tls:line: "The worn-out broom that belongs to my household
The literary men of this day are

sense.def: the present, the present time; the present age

tls:text.tls:line: The literary men of this day are

sense.def: present, contemporary; in the present sequence of days/months

tls:text.tls:line: The literary men of this day are
These seven masters
These seven masters

sense.def: person (including rulers like Duke Huán of Qí etc)

tls:text.tls:line: have omitted nothing in their learning,

sense.def: in relation to, within the field of, etc

tls:text.tls:line: have no borrowed collors in their diction.

sense.def: in relation to, within the field of, etc

tls:text.tls:line: Yet they have found it most difficult to all gallop together a thousand leagues,
Yet they have found it most difficult to all gallop together a thousand leagues,

sense.def: (cause to gallop>) deploy to a full and remarkable extent

tls:text.tls:line: Yet they have found it most difficult to all gallop together a thousand leagues,

sense.def: cause to gallop > give free reign to

tls:text.tls:line: Yet they have found it most difficult to all gallop together a thousand leagues,
side by side with equal pace on their mighty steeds,
side by side with equal pace on their mighty steeds,

sense.def: shoulder to shoulder, together, side by side; momentaneously; at the same time; 十日並出

tls:text.tls:line: side by side with equal pace on their mighty steeds,
side by side with equal pace on their mighty steeds,

sense.def: the foot of the contextually determinate person

tls:text.tls:line: and thus to pay one another due respect.
A superior person examines himself to measure others;

sense.def: semantically weak marker of a new beginning within a given non-narrative abstract discourse, often a tentative summarising remark

tls:text.tls:line: A superior person examines himself to measure others;
A superior person examines himself to measure others;

tls:text.tls:line: A superior person examines himself to measure others;

sense.def: him/her/them(selves) (referring back to highest subject in the sentence)

sense.def: to estimate; assess objectively the extent of

tls:text.tls:line: A superior person examines himself to measure others;

sense.def: other persons; other people; all the other people

tls:text.tls:line: and thus he is able to avoid such entanglements [e.g. envy and blindness to the worth of others].
and thus he is able to avoid such entanglements [e.g. envy and blindness to the worth of others].

sense.def: avoid; escape from (something); keep away from (somebody)

tls:text.tls:line: and thus he is able to avoid such entanglements [e.g. envy and blindness to the worth of others].
and thus he is able to avoid such entanglements [e.g. envy and blindness to the worth of others].

Thus I have written a discourse on literature.

sense.def: and (sometimes, though rarely, between nominal sentences)

tls:text.tls:line: Thus I have written a discourse on literature.
Thus I have written a discourse on literature.

sense.def: written work of literary merit; (poetic) literature;

tls:text.tls:line: Wang Can excels in poetic expositions;
Wang Can excels in poetic expositions;
even though Xu Gan at times shows languid qi,

sense.def: from time to time> sometimes; often; periodically; several times; at regular intervals; all the time

tls:text.tls:line: even though Xu Gan at times shows languid qi,

sense.def: languid literary force or energy [qi is unexplained here, the gloss is based just on Wenxuan commentary which provides no argument. But the meaning persists later]

tls:text.tls:line: still he is Wang Can's match.
still he is Wang Can's match.

Yet their other writings

are no match for these.

In regard to memorials, letters and records
those of Chen Lin and Ruan Yu are preeminent in the present.
those of Chen Lin and Ruan Yu are preeminent in the present.

tls:text.tls:line: Ying Chang is agreeable but lacks vigor.

Liu Chen is vigorous but holds nothing concealed [mi; i.e. in reserve].
Liu Chen is vigorous but holds nothing concealed [mi; i.e. in reserve].

sense.def: be more significant than appears on the surface, have non-trivial depth

tls:text.tls:line: Kong Rong's form and qi are lofty an subtle
Kong Rong's form and qi are lofty an subtle
with something in them that surpasses all the others;

but he cannot sustain an argument,

and the principle in his work is not up to the diction.
and the principle in his work is not up to the diction.

tls:text.tls:line: Ordinary people value what is far away and feel contempt for what is close at hand.

sense.def: what is distant, a distant place or thing

tls:text.tls:line: Ordinary people value what is far away and feel contempt for what is close at hand.

tls:text.tls:line: They favor repute and turn their backs on substance.
They favor repute and turn their backs on substance.

tls:text.tls:line: Literature

sense.def: "Now,", "In fact," introducing new subject for the discourse, and introducing non-narrative theoretical discourse.

sense.def: written work of literary ambition; (poetic) literature;

tls:text.tls:line: is the same at the root, but differs in its branches [mo, a "branch tip," the later stages of a process].

tls:text.tls:line: is the same at the root, but differs in its branches [mo, a "branch tip," the later stages of a process].

Generally speaking, memorials and disquisitions should have dignity;

Generally speaking, memorials and disquisitions should have dignity;

tls:text.tls:line: Generally speaking, memorials and disquisitions should have dignity;

poetry and poetic exposition aspire to beauty.

tls:text.tls:line: so that a writer's ability will favor some over others.
so that a writer's ability will favor some over others.

sense.def: be one-sided, be leaning to one side; be imbalanced

Only a comprehensive talent can achieve the full complement of these forms.

In literature qi is the dominant factor.

sense.def: written work of literary ambition; (poetic) literature;

tls:text.tls:line: In literature qi is the dominant factor.
In literature qi is the dominant factor.

sense.def: the most important point; the essential thing, the main thing

tls:text.tls:line: It is not to be brought by force.

sense.def: forced, brought about through exercise of (brute, unnatural) power

tls:text.tls:line: It is not to be brought by force.
It is not to be brought by force.

sense.def: 一日而三失伍 "within one day he managed three times to loose contact with his unit"

tls:text.tls:line: It is not to be brought by force.
It is not to be brought by force.

sense.def: in a manner characterised by V2 幸而免 "have been lucky to get away"; 襁負其子而至矣"will flock to one, carrying their children in their swaddling clothes" is a more complex case that could be interpreted in many ways.

tls:text.tls:line: It is not to be brought by force.
Compare it to music:

sense.def: One may compare the thing to N. It is like (often preceded by what we take to be a topic rather than a subject, which is picked up referentially by the 之 hidden in 諸)

tls:text.tls:line: Compare it to music:
though melodies be equal
though melodies be equal
and though the rhythms follow the rules,
when it comes to an inequality in drawing on a reserve of qi,
when it comes to an inequality in drawing on a reserve of qi,

sense.def: pull up into action, pull forth (literary verve 氣 etc)

tls:text.tls:line: when it comes to an inequality in drawing on a reserve of qi,
we have grounds to distinguish skill and clumsiness.
Although it may reside in a rather,
Although it may reside in a rather,

sense.def: a father or an elder/eldest brother

tls:text.tls:line: he cannot transfer it to his son; nor can an elder brother transfer it to the younger.

sense.def: e.g. 以告(君）"reported the matter (to the ruler) object marker: 把它

tls:text.tls:line: he cannot transfer it to his son; nor can an elder brother transfer it to the younger.

sense.def: transmit the contextually determinate object N1 to N2

tls:text.tls:line: he cannot transfer it to his son; nor can an elder brother transfer it to the younger.
I would say that literary works are the supreme achievement in the business of state,

sense.def: semantically weak marker of a new beginning within a given non-narrative abstract discourse, often a tentative summarising remark

tls:text.tls:line: I would say that literary works are the supreme achievement in the business of state,
I would say that literary works are the supreme achievement in the business of state,

sense.def: govern well, govern properly; deal with efficiently as the person responsible

tls:text.tls:line: I would say that literary works are the supreme achievement in the business of state,

sense.def: important, substantial; the most important 甚大

tls:text.tls:line: a splendor that does not decay.
a splendor that does not decay.
a splendor that does not decay.

glory and pleasure go no further than this body.
glory and pleasure go no further than this body.

tls:text.tls:line: glory and pleasure go no further than this body.

there is nothing to compare with the unending permanence of the literary work.

there is nothing to compare with the unending permanence of the literary work.

entrusted their persons to ink and the brush

entrusted their persons to ink and the brush
entrusted their persons to ink and the brush
and let their thoughts be seen in their compositions;
and let their thoughts be seen in their compositions;

depending neither on a good historian

tls:text.tls:line: depending neither on a good historian
depending neither on a good historian

nor on momentum from a powerful patron,

their reputations were handed down to posterity on their own force.

the Duke of Zhou, though in his glory, prescribed the Rites.
the Duke of Zhou, though in his glory, prescribed the Rites.
the Duke of Zhou, though in his glory, prescribed the Rites.

the latter was not distracted by health and pleasure.

seg.line: 則古人賤尺璧而重寸陰，

tls:text.tls:line: how the ancients thought nothing of large jade disks [marks of wealth], but valued each moment,
